com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.recognition

Class SpenSignatureVerification

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.recognition.SpenSignatureVerification

  • public final class SpenSignatureVerification
extends Object
    This class provides methods for signature verification.
    Since:
    3.0.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  SpenSignatureVerification.ResultListener
      This listener interface provides callback methods for getting signature recognition results.
      Register this listener to get results for the request(List) method.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int VERIFICATION_LEVEL_HIGH
      High level security for signature verification.
      static int VERIFICATION_LEVEL_LOW
      Low level security for signature verification.
      static int VERIFICATION_LEVEL_MEDIUM
      Medium level security for signature verification.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void completeRegistration()
      Apply registering signature.
      The method confirms the signature registration after the minimum number of registration is satisfied.
      int getMinimumRequiredCount()
      Get the minimum number of signatures required for the signature engine to verify a signature.
      Signatures required can vary from engine to engine.
      int getRegisteredCount()
      Get the number of registered signatures.
      int getVerificationLevel()
      Get the current security level for signature verification.
      boolean isRegistrationCompleted()
      Check if the registered signature exists.
      boolean isRegistrationPrepared()
      Check if the registration counts is satisfied with the minimum required registration count.
      void prepareRegistration(List<SpenObjectStroke> stroke)
      Add a signature to train signature model.
      This method adds one signature to train signature model.
      void register(List<SpenObjectStroke> stroke)
      Register a signature.
      This method registers one signature at a time.
      void request(List<SpenObjectStroke> stroke)
      Verify the specified stroke input and request the results.
      The response for this method is returned asynchronously.
      void setResultListener(SpenSignatureVerification.ResultListener listener)
      Set the SpenSignatureVerification.ResultListener instance to receive results for the request(List) method.
      You can call request(List) after setting the listener.
      void setVerificationLevel(int level)
      Set the specified security level for signature verification.
      Higher levels provide more security.
      void unregisterAll()
      Remove all the registered signatures.
      You cannot remove a signature selectively.

    • Method Detail

      • getMinimumRequiredCount

        public int getMinimumRequiredCount()
        Get the minimum number of signatures required for the signature engine to verify a signature.
        Signatures required can vary from engine to engine.
        Returns:
        The minimum number of signatures required by the engine.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Thrown if the signature verification plug-in cannot be loaded.
        Since:
        3.0.0

      • register

        public void register(List<SpenObjectStroke> stroke)
              throws Exception
        Register a signature.
        This method registers one signature at a time. Call this method repeatedly to register multiple signatures. The minimum number of signatures required can vary from engine to engine.
        Parameters:
        stroke - The list of strokes of the signature that you want to registered.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Thrown when the signature verification plug-in is not loaded.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when the stroke passed is invalid.
        InvocationTargetException - Thrown when the signature verification engine returns an error.
        Exception
        Since:
        3.0.0
        See Also:
        getMinimumRequiredCount(), unregisterAll()

      • unregisterAll

        public void unregisterAll()
                   throws Exception
        Remove all the registered signatures.
        You cannot remove a signature selectively. You can only remove all the signatures at once.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Thrown when the signature verification engine is not loaded yet.
        InvocationTargetException - Thrown if the recognition engine returns an error.
        Exception
        Since:
        3.0.0
        See Also:
        register(List)

      • getRegisteredCount

        public int getRegisteredCount()
        Get the number of registered signatures.
        Returns:
        The number of registered signatures.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Thrown when the signature verification engine is not loaded yet.
        Since:
        3.0.0
        See Also:
        register(List), getMinimumRequiredCount()

      • setVerificationLevel

        public void setVerificationLevel(int level)
        Set the specified security level for signature verification.
        Higher levels provide more security.
        Parameters:
        level - The security level for signature verification.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Thrown when the signature verification plug-in is not loaded yet.
        Since:
        3.0.0
        See Also:
        getVerificationLevel(), VERIFICATION_LEVEL_HIGH, VERIFICATION_LEVEL_MEDIUM, VERIFICATION_LEVEL_LOW

      • getVerificationLevel

        public int getVerificationLevel()
        Get the current security level for signature verification.
        Returns:
        The current signature level.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Thrown when the signature verification plug-in is not loaded yet.
        Since:
        3.0.0
        See Also:
        setVerificationLevel(int)

      • request

        public void request(List<SpenObjectStroke> stroke)
             throws Exception
        Verify the specified stroke input and request the results.
        The response for this method is returned asynchronously. To receive the results, register your SpenSignatureVerification.ResultListener instance.
        Parameters:
        stroke - The list of input strokes for signature verification.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Thrown when the signature verification engine is not loaded.
        InvocationTargetException - Thrown when the engine returns an error.
        Exception
        Since:
        3.0.0
        See Also:
        setResultListener(ResultListener)

      • setResultListener

        public void setResultListener(SpenSignatureVerification.ResultListener listener)
                       throws Exception
        Set the SpenSignatureVerification.ResultListener instance to receive results for the request(List) method.
        You can call request(List) after setting the listener.
        Parameters:
        listener - The ResultListener instance to receive results for the request(List) method.
        Throws:
        InvocationTargetException - Thrown when the engine returns an error.
        Exception
        Since:
        3.0.0
        See Also:
        request(List)

      • prepareRegistration

        public void prepareRegistration(List<SpenObjectStroke> stroke)
                         throws Exception
        Add a signature to train signature model.
        This method adds one signature to train signature model. Call this method repeatedly to add multiple signatures. The minimum number of signatures required can vary from engine to engine. You can call completeRegistration() to store signature model after the minimum number of signatures are added.
        Parameters:
        stroke - The list of strokes of the signature that you want to registered.
        Throws:
        Exception - Thrown when the engine returns an error.
        InvocationTargetException - Thrown if the recognition engine returns an error.
        Since:
        4.0.0
        See Also:
        completeRegistration()

      • isRegistrationPrepared

        public boolean isRegistrationPrepared()
                               throws Exception
        Check if the registration counts is satisfied with the minimum required registration count.
        Returns:
        If the registration is completed
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Thrown when the engine returns an error.
        InvocationTargetException - Thrown if the recognition engine returns an error.
        Exception
        Since:
        4.0.0
        See Also:
        register(List), getRegisteredCount()

      • completeRegistration

        public void completeRegistration()
                          throws Exception
        Apply registering signature.
        The method confirms the signature registration after the minimum number of registration is satisfied.
        Throws:
        Exception - Thrown when the engine returns an error.
        InvocationTargetException - Thrown if the recognition engine returns an error.
        Since:
        4.0.0
        See Also:
        register(List)

      • isRegistrationCompleted

        public boolean isRegistrationCompleted()
        Check if the registered signature exists.
        Returns:
        If the registered signature exists.
        Throws:
        InvocationTargetException - Thrown if the recognition engine returns an error.
        Since:
        4.0.0
        See Also:
        #completeRegistration(List), getRegisteredCount()
